729142f-a.folder: Melvin Avenue & Wild Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729142f-a.text:
Melvin Avenue (right), at the N.E. corner of Wild Avenue. The building is on the Louis Schmul property and was, presumable, a dance hall for the
citizenry of Linoleumville.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr

729904f-a.folder: Wild Avenue & Melvin Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729904f-a.text:
Wild Avenue, east side, between Melvin Avenue and Pearson Street, showing an old house on the Louis Schmul proDenty. Thus property was deducateu, in Rpril, 1e39, as Schmul Park, after Louis Schmul donated tne land to the City of New York to be developed as a public park and children's playground.
